abstract: Amgen agrees to buy Onyx Pharmaceuticals for about $10.4 billion. | Muriel Siebert, the first woman to buy a seat on the New York Stock Exchange, has died at 80. | Inside New York’s investment houses, shoeshine service has proved remarkably resilient. | Pawnshops are looking to fill a void left by banks.
snippet: Amgen agrees to buy Onyx Pharmaceuticals for about $10.4 billion. | Muriel Siebert, the first woman to buy a seat on the New York Stock Exchange, has died at 80. | Inside New York’s investment houses, shoeshine service has proved remarkably resili...
lead_paragraph: Amgen, the world’s biggest biotechnology company, is gaining access to three anticancer treatments with a deal on Sunday to buy Onyx Pharmaceuticals for about $10.4 billion in cash, Andrew Pollack and Michael J. de la Merced report in DealBook. Amgen is offering $125 a share in cash through a tender offer for Onyx’s shares. The deal is expected to close at the beginning of the fourth quarter, subject to regulatory approval.
